intro: Randia mindoroensis, commonly known as Mindoro randia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas of forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
